skill.name: scientific-schematics
skill.description: Create publication-quality scientific diagrams using Nano Banana Pro AI with smart iterative refinement. Uses Gemini 3 Pro for quality review. Only regenerates if quality is below threshold for your document type. Specialized in neural network architectures, system diagrams, flowcharts, biological pathways, and complex scientific visualizations.
skill.summary: Create publication-quality scientific diagrams using Nano Banana Pro AI with smart iterative refinem...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate scientific diagram generation tool using AI (Nano Banana Pro + Gemini 3 Pro). All 388 static findings are false positives - the analyzer flagged standard, necessary patterns for API calls, credential handling, and subprocess execution that this AI-powered tool requires to function. No evidence of malicious intent, data exfiltration, or unauthorized access.

content.value_statement: Create publication-quality scientific diagrams for papers, posters, and presentations. Describe your diagram in natural language and let AI generate neural network architectures, biological pathways, flowcharts, and system diagrams automatically.
actual_capabilities: Generates neural network architectures from natural language descriptions
Creates biological pathway diagrams with labeled molecular interactions
Produces CONSORT flowcharts for clinical trial documentation
Makes system architecture diagrams for technical papers
Automatic quality review with iterative refinement
limitations: Requires OpenRouter API key for AI generation
Currently limited to PNG output format

use_cases.title: Create figures for manuscripts
use_cases.description: Generate publication-quality diagrams for journal submissions, theses, and research papers with automatic quality checks.

use_cases.title: Visualize research concepts
use_cases.description: Create clear diagrams for presentations, posters, and dissertations without needing graphic design skills.

use_cases.title: Document ML architectures
use_cases.description: Generate professional neural network architecture diagrams for technical documentation and reports.

prompt_templates.title: Simple flowchart
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a flowchart showing process steps. Start with input, show three processing steps, end with output. Label all boxes clearly.

prompt_templates.title: Neural network
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a neural network architecture diagram. Include input layer (784 nodes), two hidden layers (256 and 128 nodes), and output layer (10 nodes). Show all connections between layers.

prompt_templates.title: Biological pathway
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a biological signaling pathway: Receptor â†’ Kinase A â†’ Kinase B â†’ Transcription Factor â†’ Gene expression. Label each step and use different colors for components.

prompt_templates.title: CONSORT flowchart
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a CONSORT participant flow diagram. Start with Assessed for eligibility (n=500). Show Excluded (n=150) with reasons. Continue with Randomized (n=350) split into Treatment (n=175) and Control (n=175). End with final analysis numbers.

output_examples.input: Create a transformer architecture diagram with encoder and decoder stacks

best_practices: Be specific about layout direction (left-to-right, top-to-bottom) and include quantitative details like node counts and sample sizes
Specify color requirements upfront - request colorblind-safe palettes (Okabe-Ito) for maximum accessibility
Use iterative refinement for complex diagrams - scores below threshold trigger automatic prompt improvement
anti_patterns: Avoid vague prompts like 'Make a neural network' - specify architecture type, layer counts, and connection patterns
Do not rely solely on default quality thresholds - adjust --doc-type based on publication venue requirements
Avoid skipping quality review checks - review the _review_log.json to understand diagram strengths and weaknesses

faq.question: What diagram types are supported?
faq.answer: Neural networks, biological pathways, CONSORT/PRISMA flowcharts, system architectures, circuit diagrams, and any scientific visualization described in natural language.

faq.question: How do I get an API key?
faq.answer: Visit openrouter.ai/keys to create a free account and generate an API key. Set it with: export OPENROUTER_API_KEY='your_key'.

faq.question: What quality thresholds should I use?
faq.answer: Journal (8.5) for peer-reviewed papers, conference (8.0) for proceedings, poster (7.0) for presentations, presentation (6.5) for slides.

faq.question: Can I use the generated images commercially?
faq.answer: Yes, images generated through OpenRouter are typically yours to use. Check OpenRouter terms for specific licensing details.

faq.question: Why did my diagram stop after one iteration?
faq.answer: Smart iteration stops early when quality meets the threshold. A score of 7.5 for a poster (threshold 7.0) means no further refinement needed.

faq.question: How can I improve diagram quality?
faq.answer: Make prompts more specific about layout, labels, colors, and quantitative details. Increase iterations to 2 for complex diagrams. Check review logs for specific improvement suggestions.
